A class representing a concept map

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{nodes} -- a list of nodes (by default all existing node documents)

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{edges} -- a list of edges (by default all existing edge documents)

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\index{find\_prerequisites() (concept\_map.ConceptMap method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{concept_map:concept_map.ConceptMap.find_prerequisites}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{find\_prerequisites}}{\emph{postreq}, \emph{prereqs}, \emph{sources}}{}
Return a list of parent self.edges given a certain edge from a list of self.edges, filtered by a list of sources
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{postreq} ({\hyperref[\detokenize{edge:edge.Edge}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{Edge}}}}) -- The edge which is currently investigated for parent self.edges

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{prereqs} (\href{https://docs.python.org/2/library/functions.html\#list}{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{list}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{(}{\hyperref[\detokenize{edge:edge.Edge}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{Edge}}}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{)}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{}) -- A list of already found parent self.edges (starts usually empty, necessary for recursion)

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{sources} (\href{https://docs.python.org/2/library/functions.html\#list}{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{list}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{(}\href{https://docs.python.org/2/library/string.html\#module-string}{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{string}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{)}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{}) -- A list of the currently read sources, self.edges which have a source not included in this list  will not be included in the resulting list

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
A list of self.edges which are prerequisites from edge

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\href{https://docs.python.org/2/library/functions.html\#list}{list}({\hyperref[\detokenize{edge:module-edge}]{\sphinxcrossref{edge}}})

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{to\_dict() (concept\_map.ConceptMap method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{concept_map:concept_map.ConceptMap.to_dict}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{to\_dict}}{}{}
Returns a dictionary representation of this object

The representation is compatible for use with vis.js, with `self.nodes' entries containing an `id' and `label', and `self.edges' entries containing an `id', `label', `from', `to', and an additional `source' entry
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Result}] \leavevmode
The dictionary representation, compatible with visjs

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\href{https://docs.python.org/2/library/stdtypes.html\#dict}{dict}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}


\end{fulllineitems}



\section{consumer module}
\label{\detokenize{consumer:consumer-module}}\label{\detokenize{consumer::doc}}\label{\detokenize{consumer:module-consumer}}\index{consumer (module)}\index{Consumer (class in consumer)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{consumer:consumer.Consumer}}\pysigline{\sphinxstrong{class }\sphinxcode{consumer.}\sphinxbfcode{Consumer}}
Bases: \href{https://docs.python.org/2/library/functions.html\#object}{\sphinxcode{object}}

This is the class from which the program is controlled. It can be used together with the {\hyperref[\detokenize{handler:module-handler}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{handler}}}} module in order to communicate with an external client over a websocket
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Variables}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
{\hyperref[\detokenize{concept_map:module-concept_map}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{concept\_map}}}} -- The concept map object containing references to nodes and edges

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{SOURCES} -- All of the sources referenced to in the edges of the concept map

\item {} 
{\hyperref[\detokenize{user:module-user}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{user}}}} -- The active user

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\begin{fulllineitems}

\index{provide\_learning() (consumer.Consumer method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{consumer:consumer.Consumer.provide_learning}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{provide\_learning}}{}{}
Provides a dict containing relevant information for learning

Provides a dict containing the keyword ``NO\_MORE\_INSTANCES'', ``READ\_SOURCE-REQUEST'', or ``LEARNING-RESPONSE'' and relevant data (the source string for ``READ\_SOURCE-REQUEST'' or either the output of \sphinxcode{ConceptMap.to\_dict()} with an added `learning' entry or the output of \sphinxcode{Flashcard.to\_dict()} for ``LEARNING-RESPONSE'' with an added condition entry)
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
A dict containing `keyword' and the relevant `data' described above

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\href{https://docs.python.org/2/library/stdtypes.html\#dict}{dict}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{validate() (consumer.Consumer method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}

\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Variables}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{from\_node} -- The parent node of the edge

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{to\_node} -- The child node of the edge

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{label} -- A label describing the relation between from\_node and to\_node

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{sources} -- The source where this edge is described (e.g. paragraph 13.2 from Laagland)

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\item[{Variables}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{question} -- The question on the front side of the flashcard

\item {}

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{sources} -- The edges where this flashcard is based on

\item {}

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\section{handler module}
\label{\detokenize{handler:module-handler}}\label{\detokenize{handler::doc}}\label{\detokenize{handler:handler-module}}\index{handler (module)}\index{handler() (in module handler)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{handler:handler.handler}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{handler.}\sphinxbfcode{handler}}{\emph{websocket}, \emph{path}}{}
Initiate an asyncio thread which receives messages from a client, parse the json file to an object, pass them to consumer() and send the result back to the client
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Variables}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{websocket} -- the websocket being used for receiving and sending messages to a client

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{path} -- the IP address used to host the websocket

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

A class describing a general flash instance, which can either be a FlashmapInstance or a FlashcardInstance
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Variables}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{responses} -- A list of responses provided to this instance (an empty list by default)

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{reference} -- A reference to either an edge in a concept map or a flashcard (defined within the subclass)

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{due\_date} -- The date this instance is due for repetition

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\index{get\_exponent() (instance.Instance method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{instance:instance.Instance.get_exponent}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{get\_exponent}}{}{}
Determines the exponent for the rescheduling of this instance
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
The amount of times this instance was answered correctly since the previous incorrect answer

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\href{https://docs.python.org/2/library/functions.html\#int}{int}

\index{create\_questionnaire() (user.User method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{user:user.User.create_questionnaire}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{create\_questionnaire}}{\emph{pu\_items}, \emph{peou\_items}}{}
A method for creating a new questionnaire
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{pu\_items} -- A list of perceived usefulness items

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{peou\_items} -- A list of perceived ease of use items

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
A randomised list of questionnaire items

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
\href{https://docs.python.org/2/library/functions.html\#list}{list}({\hyperref[\detokenize{questionnaire_item:questionnaire_item.QuestionnaireItem}]{\sphinxcrossref{QuestionnaireItem}}})

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\begin{fulllineitems}

\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {}
